title: Champions League: Real Madrid and Napoli advance to the quarterfinals
description: Real Madrid eliminated Liverpool from the competition for a third consecutive season while Napoli beat Eintracht Frankfurt 3-0 to reach the Champions League quarterfinals for the first time in its club's history.

title: OpenAI unveils GPT-4 with improved capabilities but limited transparency
description: The Californian company has presented a new version of the language processing software on which its now famous chatbot ChatGPT is based.

title: US top envoy Blinken says Ethiopia must do more on Tigray peace deal
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said there is 'a lot to be done' with its northern Tigray region afrer hundreds of thousands were killed in the Tigray conflict before a peace agreement was signed in November.

title: Macron and Africa, a relationship proving tough to rebuild
description: On the occasion of a quick trip to Gabon, Angola, Congo, and DRC, the French president aimed to restore relationships between France and the continent, but has little to show.

title: Macron's pension plan advances despite strikes, lawmakers to vote Thursday
description: The lower Assemblée Nationale and the Senate will vote on Emmanuel Macron's highly-contested pension reform on Thursday.

title: Fearing giant earthquake in Turkey, some Istanbul residents flee
description: The double earthquake of February 6, in Kahramanmaras, which officially killed more than 48,000 in Turkey alone, rekindles awareness of a seismic risk among Istanbul's 16 million residents.

title: Convergent evolution sheds light on study of two seemingly identical butterflies
description: An international team of scientists has shown the role of epigenetics in the convergent evolution of two South American lepidopterans.

title: Modest growth seen for French economy, forecasts national statistics agency
description: France's economy is the second biggest in the eurozone.

title: Germany's Bundeswehr 'even more ill-equipped' than before Ukraine war, says parliamentary commissioner
description: 'Not one cent' of the €100 billion promised by Olaf Scholz a year ago has reached German soldiers, says a report by the Bundestag's Parliamentary Commissioner Eva Högl.

title: Last-gasp garbage strike seeks to thwart French pension reform
description: Despite two months of protests and cross-sector strikes, the bill championed by President Emmanuel Macron appears on the verge of being pushed through parliament.

title: Malawi appeals for international aid after hundreds killed by Cyclone Freddy
description: Malawi has declared a state of disaster with at least 225 people confirmed dead after Cyclone Freddy ripped through southern Africa for a second time, triggering floods and landslides.

title: Central banks stave off financial market failures
description: Panic in the US was put to a halt by the decisive intervention of the Fed, even if it meant deviating from the usual way of doing things. Now, the ECB will have to tread carefully.

title: In Brazil, the embarrassing affair of Jair Bolsonaro's jewels
description: The former president is accused of having tried to sneak a Chopard set of jewels worth €3 million into the country, a gift from the Saudi government.

title: Former French football boss Le Graët favored friends and family at the 2022 World Cup final
description: 'Le Monde' can reveal that the former president of the French Football Federation gave his family and friends VIP tickets allocated by FIFA. Twenty-eight people in his close circle made the trip to Qatar.

title: 'We are now in a wartime economy', says France's top military procurement official
description: Emmanuel Chiva, the head of the French Ministry of Defense's procurement agency, outlines the actions undertaken to remove 'bottlenecks' in the defense industries, in an interview with 'Le Monde'.

title: War in Ukraine becomes an issue in Republican presidential primary
description: From Donald Trump to Nikki Haley to Ron DeSantis, the declared or potential candidates have disparate views on the conflict in Europe.

title: Germany: Strikes spread across services sector for wage increases
description: The country's unions are calling for a 10.5%-12% increase in wages with their position strengthened by a current labor shortage.

title: Pension reform protests: Map of the March 15 demonstrations across France
description: Based on reports from authorities, unions, and the regional press, Le Monde is tracking the number of demonstrators across France, on March 15. The map is updated throughout the day.

title: Turkey: Multiple dead after floods in quake-affected provinces
description: Floods caused by torrential rains hit two provinces, killing at least ten people and increasing the misery for thousands who were left homeless in last month's quake.

title: Credit Suisse shares sink to historic low, top shareholder rules out further investment
description: The Saudi National Bank ruled out upping its stake in Switzerland's second-biggest lender.

title: The lessons to be learned from Silicon Valley Bank's collapse
description: In addition to the inadequacies of current banking regulation in the United States, the second lesson to be learned from the closure of the SVB bank is the impact of rising interest rates.

title: UK: Mass strikes on day of budget presentation
description: The chancellor of the exchequer is to deliver his tax and spending plan to Parliament, as teachers, doctors, civil servants, BBC journalists and others stage the latest day of mass walkouts.

title: American workers rediscover a taste for time off
description: Employees who used to always be willing to work unpaid overtime or weekends have discovered the importance of having a life outside of work.

title: 'The other front of the Russian offensive is a hybrid war aimed at weakening the EU and democracy'
description: It would be misguided to believe that all the Kremlin's energy is solely focused on Ukraine's Donbas. In Georgia, Moldova, Serbia, Italy and Africa, an offensive of another type is intensifying, writes 'Le Monde' editorialist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Estonia finds new uses for former secretive Soviet submarine base
description: Once a closed port city, the town of Paldiski will host new facilities, including NATO military equipment.

title: French pension reform: Trade unions fill up war chests to support strikers
description: Trade unions can boast of large funds to help mitigate the loss of income for employees who take days off work to protest the French government's divisive reform. One such fund has no less than €150 million.

title: Washington and Moscow play it cool after US drone 'hit' by Russian plane over the Black Sea
description: The US denounced it as a 'reckless, 'unprofessional' and 'unsound' act and summoned the Russian ambassador. But the Russian Defense Minister denied any contact between the aircraft.

title: Danish government to set up $1 billion fund for Ukraine aid
description: The measure is part of a wave of support from Western nations, which have pledged a steady flow of aid to Ukraine since Russia's invasion a year ago.

title: Pakistan ex-PM Khan defies arrest amid violent clash between supporters and police
description: The former prime minister said his house had been under heavy attack, claiming 'real intent is to abduct and assassinate.'

title: 'Forver chemicals': US moves to enforce stricter limits in drinking water
description: The Environmental Protection Agency proposed new rules on polyfluoroalkyl and perfluoroalkyl substances, known as PFAS, that have been found to cause cancer and other health problems.

title: President Biden opens Alaska to huge oil project
description: Led by Texas giant ConocoPhillips, the drilling, located on federal lands, is expected to eventually produce 180,000 barrels a day.

title: France faces threat of a new drought
description: An environmental report released on Monday found that 80% of groundwater levels are below normal levels. Problems could arise as early as spring.

title: Germany's repeated flip-flops raise concerns in Brussels
description: First the combustion engine, then the stability pact: Due to dissension within the ruling coalition, Berlin is reneging on approved EU texts.

title: SVB collapse causes few scares in France, but no deep concern
description: The magnitude of the shock in the United States was far greater than in France, and the French start-up scene does not seem worried.

title: Abortion rights activist sentenced by court in Poland
description: Justyna Wydrzynska will have to perform eight months of community service for sending abortion pills to a Polish woman in distress in 2020.

title: Last-gasp strikes seek to prevent French pension reform
description: France faces another day of strikes on Wednesday over highly contested pension reforms which President Emmanuel Macron appears on the verge of pushing through despite months of protests.

title: Faced with China, Australia beefs up its deterrence and defense capabilities
description: The country is preparing to make a gigantic investment through the tripartite agreement concluded with the United States and the United Kingdom. Australia is particularly planning to acquire nuclear-powered submarines.

title: The children of deceased Russian journalist Irina Slavina divided by the war
description: The journalist, who was harassed by Russian police and the country's justice system, set herself on fire in 2020. Her children have since taken opposite paths.

title: France's aging population is a challenge that goes far beyond the pensions issue
description: France's demographic trajectory raises many questions: the surge in dependency, labor shortages and stagnant savings, issues that the conflict over the pension reform has pushed into the background.

title: Federal Reserve on the verge of losing control of inflation
description: The bankruptcy of Silicon Valley Bank and the resulting need to shore up financial stability has further weakened the hand of the institution headed by Jerome Powell.

title: Honduras to establish diplomatic ties with China
description: President Xiomara Castro announced Tuesday that her government plans to open diplomatic relations with China, which would imply severing relations with Taiwan. Honduras is one of the few remaining allies of Taiwan.

title: In the Netherlands, a party defends farmers against the 'nitrogen plan' of Mark Rutte's government
description: The coalition government has planned to invest €25 billion to reduce nitrogen emissions by 50% by 2030, implying a 30% reduction in livestock and the closure of some farms. The majority in the Senate is at stake in the provincial elections on Wednesday, March 15.

title: Maxime Frédéric, an exceptional pastry chef
description: Head pastry chef at the Parisian luxury hotel Cheval Blanc, Maxime Frédéric is the creator of a sweet collection bearing the Louis Vuitton signature. The Norman chef has built his dazzling career on a prodigious savoir-faire, taking inspiration from his roots that he cultivates on the family farm.

title: 27,000 evacuated as another storm hits soggy California
description: The tenth atmospheric of the season has roared ashore, dropping more heavy rain on a storm-weary state.
